website_summaries.verdict: PRO Barriers are great for keeping a cyclist’s feet warm and dry on the ugliest of days, and their high visibility and contrasting design go a long way toward getting drivers to notice you.
pros: Sized from small to extra, extra large
cons: Note these are water resistant, not waterproof

customer_reviews.title: Started coming apart after 1 ride!
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about these. I gave them a test ride on my indoor bike for 15 minutes and they kept my feet so warm that I had to take them off. They fit perfectly over my shoes and were easy to put on and take off. It warmed up to 37 degrees outside and I decided to go for an outdoor ride, they kept my feet warm and dry, but one already started to come apart at the seams..after one ride (only 8 miles)! It looks almost like a dog used it as a chew toy. Disappointed and hoping I can get a replacement. Otherwise I'm on the hunt for something better.
customer_reviews.author: K Mc

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected but quality construction
customer_reviews.text: Initial reaction: Construction looks solid and the material has some stretch to it, which is good as the Large barely covers a size 9 men’s biking shoe (EU 42). Buy a size or two larger than you think you’d need based on shoe size. Will update again as I use them if there are any surprises, but they feel like they’ll do good againt wins and rain.
customer_reviews.author: Bibbs

customer_reviews.title: Warm, not completely waterproof
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely solid - but don't get them if you want your feet to stay completely dry. For a hour-long commute in the winter rain, I found my feet to definitely be dryer than they would have been without the overshoes but I still needed to dry my shoes after the ride. I would not say this is a design flaw - just keep in mind if you are looking for a completely waterproof option. They are definitely warm! They stop the wind really well, which helps with numb toes.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: finally a mainstream rain bootie that fits size 14 MTB
customer_reviews.text: I bought the XXL. All previous brand-name booties (eg Sugoi, Bontrager) could not fit around the heel of a size 14 MTB shoe. THis bootie has a new heel design (two velcro straps) that makes it much easier to use. Still a tight fit mind you, I would have preferred a larger size, but it seems practical, unlike the rest. Cannot speak to durability, but so far it has done the job on two rainy 10-mile rides.
customer_reviews.author: LoRider

customer_reviews.title: it was great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: They worked great at first. It kept my feet warm, dry and fit tightly over my shoes, but it started to rip and fall apart after only a couple of months.
customer_reviews.author: Charles

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than size chart says
customer_reviews.text: These run small. I followed the size chart and bought an XL for my 11.5 (US) size MTB shoes, but they are too short unless I want to risk tearing them to try to get them to fit. I am giving them two stars only for size description, since I have not been able to use them on a ride.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Runs small.
customer_reviews.text: These work great but get a size larger than you think you need unless your legs are twigs.
customer_reviews.author: J. DeSimone

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad buy!
customer_reviews.text: So today was the first ride. 29 degrees with a wind chill of 13. Normal socks plus my shoes , these covers worked great for me. No wind no water nothing got in. Will update again latter on after I use them more
customer_reviews.author: Jmelito

customer_reviews.title: these are great!
customer_reviews.text: i love these shoe covers. they work fantastic. i would recommend these to my friends.
customer_reviews.author: russell perry

customer_reviews.title: Runs very small.
customer_reviews.text: Runs very small. I wear an 11 riding shoe and the xl barely fits. I had to pull so hard to get them on that I popped a seam.
customer_reviews.author: Marine Bio Joe

customer_reviews.title: I really like Pearl Izumi brands
customer_reviews.text: I really like Pearl Izumi brands. These fit the shoes just fine however the area for the calves is about half an inch short in width for me to fasten it all the way to the Velcro.
customer_reviews.author: Anna B

customer_reviews.title: Can be adjusted
customer_reviews.text: The double strap-Velcro keeps the cover tight around the shoe and ankle
customer_reviews.author: W_T_K

customer_reviews.title: Not water resistant
customer_reviews.text: This does not work. It did not keep the water out of my shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: So far so good in weather I would say 32 and above.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley N Tappen

customer_reviews.title: order up 2 sizes
customer_reviews.text: The good: Product is nice looking. They kept my feet warm in 30 degree mountain bike rides - i normally do not ride any colder than that so I cant say how much lower they can work, but they will prevent the wind form cooling your feet. I use SPD clipless and no issues with function. The bad: I am a man 10.5 normal width (no bigfoot here) and the XXL seems to barely fit my low profile mtb shoes. Not sure if this is Japan sizing? Good thing I read the reviews first and ordered up the size.
customer_reviews.author: LouFromDetroit

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: i bought XL and wear US size 10. i do not have sleek cycling shoes nor mtb something in the middle and these fit perfect. only used once so far and it wasnt cold nor rainy so no real feedback on those fronts yet but seem great as far as i can tell. will update if necessary.
customer_reviews.author: DonVolcano

customer_reviews.title: run small, and delicate material
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Large size, which just fits over my US men's size road-bike style cleats, just fine. However, you trade extremely light-weight streamline design for durability. I've had them for about a year, but have handled them carefully. (They fit almost like a condom stretched over your shoes.) While they keep rain off your shoes and the wind out, they offer no thermal protection, and the edges of the soles wear out fairly quickly if you dare walk in them on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: John

product_meta.title: PEARL IZUMI PRO Barrier WxB Shoe Cover
product_meta.description: When the conditions get wet, keep pedaling with the PRO Barrier WxB Shoe Covers. Our waterproof and breathable shoe covers will keep your feet warm and dry. Equipped with a two stage hook and loop closure which offers the best fit allowing you to adjust both behind the heel and at the ankle. It also makes it easy to get the shoe covers on and off.
feature_bullets: PRO Barrier WxB fabric provides optimal wind and water protection
"Fleece lined interior for warmth paired with waterproof, taped external seams to keep your feet dry and warm"
Second generation two stage hook and loop closure provides both sleek fit and easy on and off
Durable rubber toe area provides superior traction on wet surfaces
Designed for road shoes with external cleats
